column5: Need Help we are heading to Minaki to try fishing the great white north any suggestions on where to start for bass & walleyes.Thanks in advance Bro's
In a cabin near Myrtall rapids?as far as I knowThanks

I fish there a couple of times a year and if you want good walleye fish to the just to the north of Myrtle rapids. cross over the fast current about 75-150 from the rapids using a heavy bottom bouncer. make sure you have a card for the area for your gps as it can be confusing up there. good luck. Bubba

I was just fishing the area and we found walleye in 3 FOW water all the way down to 45 FOW. Used bottom bouncers for the the transition areas, points, and humps. We also saw quite a few groups jigging mostly around 20 to 25 FOW. Our favorite depth for bouncing ended up being 35 to 45 FOW. Full report can be found at http://www.nwofishing.com/2012/06/fi...uth-of-minaki/
